ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
Catch2 is mainly a unit testing framework for C++,
but it also provides basic micro-benchmarking features, and simple BDD macros.

Catch2's main advantage is that using it is both simple and natural.
Test names do not have to be valid identifiers,
assertions look like normal C++ boolean expressions,
and sections provide a nice and local way to share set-up and tear-down code in tests.
about.summary:
A modern, C++-native, test framework for unit-tests, TDD and BDD
- using C++14, C++17 and later (C++11 support is in v2.x branch, and C++03 on the Catch1.x branch)

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "3.9.0" %}
{% set name = "catch2" %}

package:
  name: {{ name }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tgz
  url: https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 8061daf97429621bc62096841af02fc40070fad26cd04c93ee0b5a825cedb122

build:
  number: 0
  run_exports: {{ pin_subpackage(name, max_pin="x") }}

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - cmake
    - ninja

test:
  requires:
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - cmake
    - ninja

about:
  home: https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2
  license: BSL-1.0
  license_family: OTHER
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: |
    A modern, C++-native, test framework for unit-tests, TDD and BDD 
    - using C++14, C++17 and later (C++11 support is in v2.x branch, and C++03 on the Catch1.x branch)
  description: |
    Catch2 is mainly a unit testing framework for C++, 
    but it also provides basic micro-benchmarking features, and simple BDD macros.

    Catch2's main advantage is that using it is both simple and natural. 
    Test names do not have to be valid identifiers, 
    assertions look like normal C++ boolean expressions, 
    and sections provide a nice and local way to share set-up and tear-down code in tests.
  doc_url: https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/blob/v{{ version }}/docs/Readme.md
  dev_url: https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - eunos-1128
    - mjscosta
    - tdegeus

about.description:
Catch2 is mainly a unit testing framework for C++,

- using C++14, C++17 and later (C++11 support is in v2.x branch, and C++03 on the Catch1.x branch)
